examples: In the Year 1746, an Indian of Buenos Ayres having been condemned to the Gallies at Cadiz, proposed to the Governor to purchase his Liberty by exposing his Life at a public Festival.

adjectives.description: gally (comparative more gally, superlative most gally)

entries.meaning: Characterised by or resembling gall; bitter.
examples: For by the Dart, which is likewise a pipe, is made a deep passage into the skin, and then by the anger of the Fly, is his gally poisonous liquor injected […].

verbs.description: gally (third-person singular simple present gallies, present participle gallying, simple past and past participle gallied)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, UK, dialect) To frighten; to worry.
examples: The next Day being Sunday, call'd by the Natives of this Country Maze Sunday, (and indeed not without some Reason, for the People look'd as if they were gallied) […]
